Scope Notes: Functions used in generating a scientific and logistic plan for executing a research project.
Examples: Data management planning tools; concept mapping tools; project management tools

Scope Notes: Functions that involve human-machine communication necessary for the operation of some component of a research project.
Examples: list-serve software; wiki software; OAuth specification

Scope Notes: Functions enabling incorporation of new data into an information system. Data might originate from instruments or from other information systems
Examples: satellite downlink software; streaming data handlers (stream gauge); strike and dip app for mobile device; strabo

Scope Notes: Functions that enable an agent to locate and access (acquire for use) information resources
Examples: ElasticSearch; web map server (GeoServer); OpenSearch; Thredds; Apache Nutch, Sparkler

Scope Notes: interaction with data to determine usability, suitability for specific use,  for hypothesis generation, or evaluation of patterns suggesting the need for further analysis
functions to refine data for use in data analysis or other purposes. E.g. cleaning, QA/QC, transformations, documentation
Examples: MODIS cal/Val; Excel (save as); Google Refine

Scope Notes: functions to produce a higher level defined data product
Examples: MODIS L2 processing; geophysical forward modeling and inversion (e.g., SpecFEM3D, ModEM, etc); hydrological modeling (e.g., TopoFlow, ModFlow, etc); weather modeling and data assimilation (WRF)

Scope Notes: functions to orchestrate a series of tools in an automated fashion to perform some reproducible task.
functions to enable hypothesis testing or new insights from data.
Examples: Topic modeling; Named entity recognition; ArcMap; various R statistical or image processing packages;

Scope Notes: interaction with data to use human visual capabilities to understand the data better or communicate information from the data
functions to describe key aspects of a resource or its usage, or of new insights from data
functions to maintain and conserve data in a usable and useful condition for the long term
functions to support all aspects of software developement
